Reference¶

Config¶

Dictionary example

Functions¶

This is the only interface that you should ever need to get user info and credentials from a provider and to make calls to their protected resources.

authomatic.login(adapter, provider_name, callback=None, report_errors=True, logging_level=10, scope=[], **kwargs)¶

Launches a login procedure for specified provider and returns LoginResult.

Warning

Currently the method gets called twice by all providers. This may change in future.

  1. First it returns nothing but redirects the user to the provider, which redirects him back to the enclosing request handler.
  2. Then it gets called again and it finally returns the LoginResult or calls the function specified in the callback argument with LoginResult passed as argument.
Parameters:
  • adapter – Framework specific adapter with the interface of authomatic.adapters.BaseAdapter.
  • provider_name – Name of the provider as specified in the keys of the config.
  • callback – If specified the function will call the callback with LoginResult passed as argument and will return nothing.
  • report_errors – If True errors and exceptions which occur during login will be caught and accessible in the LoginResult. If False errors and exceptions will not be handled.
  • logging_level – The library logs important events during the login procedure. You can specify the desired logging level with the constants of the logging of Python standard library. The main login procedure events have level INFO, others like adapter database access have level DEBUG.
  • scope – List of strings specifying scope of the requested credentials as specified in OAuth 2.0 spec. Currently used only by providers which inherit from the authomatic.providers.oauth2.OAuth2 class.
Returns:

None or LoginResult instance.
authomatic.short_name()¶

A simple counter to be used in the config to generate unique short_name values.

Returns:int.

Use it in the config like this:

import authomatic

CONFIG = {
    'facebook': {
         'short_name': authomatic.short_name(), # returns 1
         'class_name': authomatic.providers.oauth2.Facebook,
         'consumer_key': '##########',
         'consumer_secret': '##########',
         'scope': ['user_about_me', 'email']
    },
    'google': {
         'short_name': authomatic.short_name(), # returns 2
         'class_name': 'authomatic.providers.oauth2.Google',
         'consumer_key': '##########',
         'consumer_secret': '##########',
         'scope': ['https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile',
                   'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email']
    },
    'windows_live': {
         'short_name': authomatic.short_name(), # returns 3
         'class_name': 'oauth2.WindowsLive',
         'consumer_key': '##########',
         'consumer_secret': '##########',
         'scope': ['wl.basic', 'wl.emails', 'wl.photos']
    },
}
authomatic.async_fetch(adapter, credentials, url, method='GET', content_parser=None)¶

Fetches protected resource asynchronously.

import webapp2
import authomatic
from authomatic.adapters import gaewebapp2

class Login(webapp2.RequestHandler):
    
    # accept both GET and POST HTTP methods
    def anymethod(provider_name):
        
        # create adapter
        adapter = gaewebapp2.GAEWebapp2Adapter(self)
        # login by the provider
        result = authomatic.login(adapter, provider_name)
        
        # if login was successfull and there are credentials
        if result.user and result.user.credentials and result.user.credentials.provider_name == 'fb':
            
            # serialize credentials and store it to DB or elsewhere
            sc = result.user.credentials.serialize()
            
            # fetch multiple protected resources at once with serialized credentials
            request1 = authomatic.async_fetch(adapter, sc,
                                              'https://graph.facebook.com/me/og.follows',
                                              method='GET').fetch() # returns immediately
            request2 = authomatic.async_fetch(adapter, sc,
                                              'https://graph.facebook.com/me/news.reads?article=http://example.com/article',
                                              method='POST').fetch() # returns immediately
            request3 = authomatic.async_fetch(adapter, sc,
                                              'https://graph.facebook.com/me/video.watches?video=http://example.com/video',
                                              method='POST').fetch() # returns immediately
            
            # they all now run in parallel
            # so you can do other stuff while the requests fly through the Internet
            
            # collect results
            response1 = request1.get_response() # returns when it has result
            response2 = request2.get_response() # returns when it has result
            response3 = request3.get_response() # returns when it has result

Warning

Whether the function is really asynchronous depends on the implementation of the adapter’s fetch_async() method.

Parameters:
  • adapter – The same adapter instance which was used in the login() function to get the user’s Credentials.
  • credentials – Credentials or serialized credentials of the user whose protected resource we want to access.
  • url – str The URL of the protected resource. Can contain query parameters.
  • method – str HTTP method of the request.
  • content_parser – A callable as described in Response.content_parser.
Returns:

Request
authomatic.fetch(adapter, credentials, url, method='GET', content_parser=None)¶

Fetches protected resource.

Note

Internally is it just a wrapper of authomatic.async_fetch(adapter, url, credentials, method, content_parser).get_response().

Parameters:
  • adapter – The same adapter instance which was used in the login() function to get the user’s Credentials.
  • credentials – Credentials or serialized credentials of the user whose protected resource we want to access.
  • url – str The URL of the protected resource. Can contain query parameters.
  • method – str HTTP method of the request.
  • content_parser – A callable as described in Response.content_parser.
Returns:

Response

Consumer abstraction.

str Consumer key issued for the consumer by the provider.

str Consumer secret issued for the consumer by the provider.

scope = None¶

list List of strings specifying cope as described in the OAuth 2.0 spec.

class authomatic.core.User(provider, **kwargs)[source]¶

Provides unified interface to selected user informations returned by different providers.

Note

The format of property values may vary across providers.

provider = None¶

A provider instance.

credentials = None¶

An Credentials instance.

raw_user_info = None¶

A dict containing all the user information returned by the provider. The structure differs across providers.

user_id = None¶

str ID assigned to the user by the provider.

username = None¶

str User name e.g. andrewpipkin.

name = None¶

str Name e.g. Andrew Pipkin.

first_name = None¶

str First name e.g. Andrew.

last_name = None¶

str Last name e.g. Pipkin.

nickname = None¶

str Nickname e.g. Andy.

link = None¶

str Link URL.

gender = None¶

str Gender.

timezone = None¶

str Timezone.

locale = None¶

str Locale.

email = None¶

str E-mail.

picture = None¶

str Picture URL.

birth_date = None¶

datetime.datetime() birth date .

country = None¶

str Country.

postal_code = None¶

str Postal code.

gae_user = None¶

Instance of the Google App Engine Users API User class. Only present when using the authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.GAEOpenID provider.

update()[source]¶

Updates the user info by fetching the provider’s user info URL.

Returns:Updated instance of this class.
class authomatic.core.Credentials(**kwargs)[source]¶

Contains all neccessary informations to fetch user’s protected resources.

token = None¶

str User access token.

token_secret = None¶

str User access token secret.

expiration_date = None¶

datetime.datetime() Expiration date of the access token.

provider_name = None¶

str Provider name specified in the config.

provider_type = None¶

str Provider type e.g. "authomatic.providers.oauth2.OAuth2".

provider_short_name = None¶

str Provider short name specified in the config.

consumer_key = None¶

str Consumer key specified in the config.

consumer_secret = None¶

str Consumer secret specified in the config.

expires_in[source]¶

int Lifetime of the access token in seconds.

get_provider_class()[source]¶

Returns the provider class specified in the config.

Returns:authomatic.providers.BaseProvider subclass.
serialize()[source]¶

Converts the credentials to a possibly minimal tuple and serializes it to a string to be stored for later use.

Returns:string
classmethod deserialize(adapter, serialized)[source]¶

A class method which reconstructs credentials created by serialize().

Parameters:
  • adapter – An adapter instance used by authomatic.login() to get the credentials.
  • serialized – string The serialized credentials.
Returns:

Credentials

class authomatic.core.Response(status_code, headers, content, content_parser=None)[source]¶

Response object returned by authomatic.fetch(), Request.get_response() or authomatic.adapters.RPC.get_response().

content_parser = None¶

callable A callable that takes the content as argument, parses it and returns the parsed data as dict.

status_code = None¶

int HTTP status code of the response.

headers = None¶

dict HTTP headers of the response.

content = None¶

str The response body

data[source]¶

Parses the content with content_parser.

Returns:dict
class authomatic.core.UserInfoResponse(response, user)[source]¶

A wrapper around Response which adds the user property. Returned by authomatic.providers.AuthorisationProvider.fetch_user_info().

user = None¶

A User instance.

class authomatic.core.Request(adapter, credentials, url, method='GET', response_parser=None, content_parser=None)[source]¶

Abstraction of asynchronous request to user’s protected resources.

import webapp2
import authomatic
from authomatic.core import Request
from authomatic.adapters import gaewebapp2

class Login(webapp2.RequestHandler):
    
    # accept both GET and POST HTTP methods
    def anymethod(provider_name):
        
        # create adapter
        adapter = gaewebapp2.GAEWebapp2Adapter(self)
        # login by the provider
        result = authomatic.login(adapter, provider_name)
        
        # if login was successfull and there are credentials
        if result.user and result.user.credentials and result.user.credentials.provider_name == 'fb':
            
            # serialize credentials and store it to DB or elsewhere
            sc = result.user.credentials.serialize()
            
            # fetch multiple protected resources at once with serialized credentials
            request1 = Request(adapter, sc,
                               'https://graph.facebook.com/me/og.follows',
                               method='GET').fetch() # returns immediately
            request2 = Request(adapter, sc,
                               'https://graph.facebook.com/me/news.reads?article=http://example.com/article',
                               method='POST').fetch() # returns immediately
            request3 = Request(adapter, sc,
                               'https://graph.facebook.com/me/video.watches?video=http://example.com/video',
                               method='POST').fetch() # returns immediately
            
            # they all now run in parallel
            # so you can do other stuff while the requests fly through the Internet
            
            # collect results
            response1 = request1.get_response() # returns when it has result
            response2 = request2.get_response() # returns when it has result
            response3 = request3.get_response() # returns when it has result

Warning

Whether the request is really asynchronous depends on the implementation of the adapter’s fetch_async() method.

adapter = None¶

The same adapter instance which was used in the login() function to get the user’s Credentials.

credentials = None¶

Credentials or serialized credentials of the user whose protected resource we want to access.

url = None¶

str The URL of the protected resource. Can contain query parameters.

method = None¶

str HTTP method of the request.

response_parser = None¶

callable A callable that takes the platform specific fetch response object as argument and converts it to a Response instance.

content_parser = None¶

callable A callable as described in Response.content_parser.

fetch()[source]¶

Fetches the protected resource and returns immediately.

Returns:self
get_response()[source]¶

Waits for the result of fetch() and returns Response.

Returns:Response

Adapters¶

class authomatic.adapters.RPC(rpc_object, response_parser, content_parser)[source]¶

Remote Procedure Call wrapper

get_response()[source]¶

Returns Response instance

class authomatic.adapters.BaseAdapter[source]¶

Base class for platform adapters

Defines common interface for platform specific (non standard library) functionality.

config()[source]¶

Any object that has the get(‘provider-name’) method which should return a provider config dictionary.

Ment to provide an alternative to a hardcoded config, i.e. Data model config.

TODO: point to config section of future documentation?

url[source]¶

Must return the url of the actual request including path but without query and fragment

params[source]¶

Must return a dictionary of all request parameters of any HTTP method.

write(value)[source]¶

Must write specified value to response.

Parameters:value – string
set_header(key, value)[source]¶

Must set response headers to key = value.

Parameters:
  • key –
  • value –
redirect(url)[source]¶

Must issue a http 302 redirect to the url

Parameters:url – string
session[source]¶

A session abstraction with BaseSession or dict interface

response_parser(response, content_parser)[source]¶

A classproperty to convert platform specific fetch response to authomatic.Response.

Must be staticmethod!

Parameters:
  • response – result of platform specific fetch call
  • content_parser – should be passed to authomatic.Response constructor.
Returns:

authomatic.Response
openid_store[source]¶

A permanent storage abstraction as described by the openid.store.interface.OpenIDStore interface of the python-openid library http://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-openid/.

Required only by the OpenID provider

fetch_async(url, payload=None, method='GET', headers={}, response_parser=None, content_parser=None)[source]¶
